trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="How to use multiple clients with a single mobile service backend | Azure Mobile Services" description="Learn how to use a single mobile service back-end from multiple client apps that target different mobile platforms." services="mobile-services" documentationCenter="" authors="ggailey777" manager="dwrede" editor="mollybos"/> <tags ms.service="mobile-services" ms.workload="mobile" ms.tgt_pltfrm="mobile-multiple" ms.devlang="multiple" ms.topic="article" ms.date="12/07/2015" ms.author="glenga"/>
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="How to use multiple clients with a single mobile service backend | Azure Mobile Services" description="Learn how to use a single mobile service back-end from multiple client apps that target different mobile platforms." services="mobile-services" documentationCenter="" authors="ggailey777" manager="dwrede" editor="mollybos"/> <tags ms.service="mobile-services" ms.workload="mobile" ms.tgt_pltfrm="mobile-multiple" ms.devlang="multiple" ms.topic="article" ms.date="12/07/2015" ms.author="glenga"/>

trans-unit.source: Supporting multiple device platforms from a single mobile service
trans-unit.target: Supporting multiple device platforms from a single mobile service

trans-unit.source: One of the major benefits of using Azure Mobile Services in your mobile app development is the ability to use a single backend service that supports your app on multiple client platforms.
trans-unit.target: One of the major benefits of using Azure Mobile Services in your mobile app development is the ability to use a single backend service that supports your app on multiple client platforms.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services provides native client libraries for all major device platforms, which makes it easier to develop apps using a single backend service and by using cross-platform developer tools.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services provides native client libraries for all major device platforms, which makes it easier to develop apps using a single backend service and by using cross-platform developer tools.

trans-unit.source: This topic discusses considerations for getting your app running on multiple client platforms while using a single mobile service backend.
trans-unit.target: This topic discusses considerations for getting your app running on multiple client platforms while using a single mobile service backend.

trans-unit.source: Cross-platform push notifications
trans-unit.target: Cross-platform push notifications

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services uses Azure Notification Hubs for sending push notifications to your client apps on all major device platforms.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services uses Azure Notification Hubs for sending push notifications to your client apps on all major device platforms.

trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs provide a consistent and unified infrastructure for creating and managing device registrations and for sending cross-platform push notifications.
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs provide a consistent and unified infrastructure for creating and managing device registrations and for sending cross-platform push notifications.

trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs supports sending push notifications by using the following platform-specific notification services:
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs supports sending push notifications by using the following platform-specific notification services:

trans-unit.source: Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) for iOS apps
trans-unit.target: Apple Push Notification Service (APNS) for iOS apps

trans-unit.source: Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) service for Android apps
trans-unit.target: Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) service for Android apps

trans-unit.source: Windows Notification Service (WNS) for Windows Store, Windows Phone 8.1 Store, and universal Windows apps
trans-unit.target: Windows Notification Service (WNS) for Windows Store, Windows Phone 8.1 Store, and universal Windows apps

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) for Windows Phone Silverlight apps
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Push Notification Service (MPNS) for Windows Phone Silverlight apps

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Notification Hubs].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Notification Hubs].

trans-unit.source: Client registrations are created by using the register function in the platform-specific Mobile Services client library or by using the Mobile Services REST APIs.
trans-unit.target: Client registrations are created by using the register function in the platform-specific Mobile Services client library or by using the Mobile Services REST APIs.

trans-unit.source: Notification Hubs supports two kinds of device registrations:
trans-unit.target: Notification Hubs supports two kinds of device registrations:

trans-unit.source:
**Native registration**
Native registrations are tailored to the platform-specific push notification service.
trans-unit.target:
**Native registration**
Native registrations are tailored to the platform-specific push notification service.

trans-unit.source: When sending notifications to devices registered using native registrations, you must call platform-specific APIs in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: When sending notifications to devices registered using native registrations, you must call platform-specific APIs in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: To send a notification to devices on multiple platforms requires multiple platform-specific calls.
trans-unit.target: To send a notification to devices on multiple platforms requires multiple platform-specific calls.

trans-unit.source:
**Template registration**
Notification Hubs also supports platform-specific template registrations.
trans-unit.target:
**Template registration**
Notification Hubs also supports platform-specific template registrations.

trans-unit.source: By using template registrations, you can use a single API call to send a notification to your app running on any registered platform.
trans-unit.target: By using template registrations, you can use a single API call to send a notification to your app running on any registered platform.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Send cross-platform notifications to users].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Send cross-platform notifications to users].

trans-unit.source: Tables in the following sections link to the client-specific tutorials that show you how to implement push notifications from both .NET and JavaScript backend mobile services.
trans-unit.target: Tables in the following sections link to the client-specific tutorials that show you how to implement push notifications from both .NET and JavaScript backend mobile services.

trans-unit.source: .NET backend
trans-unit.target: .NET backend

trans-unit.source: In a .NET backend mobile service, you send notifications by calling the [SendAsync] method on the [PushClient](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.notifications.pushclient.aspx) object obtained from the [ApiServices.Push](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.apiservices.push.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: In a .NET backend mobile service, you send notifications by calling the [SendAsync] method on the [PushClient](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.notifications.pushclient.aspx) object obtained from the [ApiServices.Push](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.apiservices.push.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The push notification sent (native or template) depends on the specific [IPushMessage](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.notifications.ipushmessage.aspx)-derived object that is passed to the [SendAsync] method, as shown in the following table:
trans-unit.target: The push notification sent (native or template) depends on the specific [IPushMessage](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/microsoft.windowsazure.mobile.service.notifications.ipushmessage.aspx)-derived object that is passed to the [SendAsync] method, as shown in the following table:

trans-unit.source: Cross-platform app development
trans-unit.target: Cross-platform app development

trans-unit.source: Developing native mobile device apps for all of the major mobile device platforms requires you (or your organization) to have expertise in at least Objective-C, Java, and C# or JavaScript programming languages.
trans-unit.target: Developing native mobile device apps for all of the major mobile device platforms requires you (or your organization) to have expertise in at least Objective-C, Java, and C# or JavaScript programming languages.

trans-unit.source: Because of the expense of developing across these disparate platforms, some developers choose a fully web browser-based experience for their apps.
trans-unit.target: Because of the expense of developing across these disparate platforms, some developers choose a fully web browser-based experience for their apps.

trans-unit.source: However, such web-based experiences cannot access most of the native resources that provide the rich experience that users have come to expect on their mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: However, such web-based experiences cannot access most of the native resources that provide the rich experience that users have come to expect on their mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Cross-platform tools are available that provide a richer native experience on a mobile device, while still sharing a single code base, usually JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: Cross-platform tools are available that provide a richer native experience on a mobile device, while still sharing a single code base, usually JavaScript.

trans-unit.source: Mobile Services makes it easy to create and manage a backend service for cross-platform app development platforms by providing quickstart tutorials for the following development platforms:
trans-unit.target: Mobile Services makes it easy to create and manage a backend service for cross-platform app development platforms by providing quickstart tutorials for the following development platforms:

trans-unit.source:
[**Appcelerator**](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=509987)
Appcelerator lets you use JavaScript to develop a single app that is compiled to run as native on all mobile device platforms.
trans-unit.target:
[**Appcelerator**](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=509987)
Appcelerator lets you use JavaScript to develop a single app that is compiled to run as native on all mobile device platforms.

trans-unit.source: This provides a rich user experience in UI, access to all native device resources, and native app performance.
trans-unit.target: This provides a rich user experience in UI, access to all native device resources, and native app performance.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Appcelerator tutorial][Appcelerator].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Appcelerator tutorial][Appcelerator].

trans-unit.source:
[**PhoneGap**](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=390707)**/**[**Cordova**](http://cordova.apache.org/)
PhoneGap (a distribution of the Apache Cordova project) is a free and open source framework that lets you use standardized web APIs, HTML and JavaScript to develop a single app that runs on Android, iOS and Windows devices.
trans-unit.target:
[**PhoneGap**](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=390707)**/**[**Cordova**](http://cordova.apache.org/)
PhoneGap (a distribution of the Apache Cordova project) is a free and open source framework that lets you use standardized web APIs, HTML and JavaScript to develop a single app that runs on Android, iOS and Windows devices.

trans-unit.source: PhoneGap provides a web view based UI, but with a user experience enhanced by accessing native resources on the device, such as such as push notifications, the accelerometer, camera, storage, geolocation, and the in-app browser.
trans-unit.target: PhoneGap provides a web view based UI, but with a user experience enhanced by accessing native resources on the device, such as such as push notifications, the accelerometer, camera, storage, geolocation, and the in-app browser.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [PhoneGap quickstart tutorial][PhoneGap].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [PhoneGap quickstart tutorial][PhoneGap].

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio now also enables you to build cross-platform Cordova apps by using the Multi-Device Hybrid Apps extension for Visual Studio, which is pre-release software.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio now also enables you to build cross-platform Cordova apps by using the Multi-Device Hybrid Apps extension for Visual Studio, which is pre-release software.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Getting Started with Multi-Device Hybrid Apps Using HTML and JavaScript](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn771545.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Getting Started with Multi-Device Hybrid Apps Using HTML and JavaScript](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn771545.aspx).

trans-unit.source:
[**Sencha Touch**](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=509988)
Sencha Touch provides a set of controls, optimized for touch screens, that provide a like-native experience on a wide variety of mobile devices from a single HTML and JavaScript code base.
trans-unit.target:
[**Sencha Touch**](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=509988)
Sencha Touch provides a set of controls, optimized for touch screens, that provide a like-native experience on a wide variety of mobile devices from a single HTML and JavaScript code base.

trans-unit.source: Sencha Touch can be used along with PhoneGap or Cordova libraries to provide users access to native device resources.
trans-unit.target: Sencha Touch can be used along with PhoneGap or Cordova libraries to provide users access to native device resources.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the [Sencha Touch quickstart tutorial][Sencha].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the [Sencha Touch quickstart tutorial][Sencha].

trans-unit.source:
[**Xamarin**](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=330242)
Xamarin lets you create fully native apps for both iOS and Android devices, with fully native UI and access to all device resources.
trans-unit.target:
[**Xamarin**](https://go.microsoft.com/fwLink/p/?LinkID=330242)
Xamarin lets you create fully native apps for both iOS and Android devices, with fully native UI and access to all device resources.

trans-unit.source: Xamarin apps are coded in C# instead of Objective-C and Java.
trans-unit.target: Xamarin apps are coded in C# instead of Objective-C and Java.

trans-unit.source: This enables .NET developers to publish apps to iOS and Android and share code from Windows projects.
trans-unit.target: This enables .NET developers to publish apps to iOS and Android and share code from Windows projects.

trans-unit.source: Xamarin provides a fully native user experience on both iOS and Android devices from C# code.
trans-unit.target: Xamarin provides a fully native user experience on both iOS and Android devices from C# code.

trans-unit.source: This enables you to reuse some of your Mobile Services code from Windows apps on iOS and Android devices.
trans-unit.target: This enables you to reuse some of your Mobile Services code from Windows apps on iOS and Android devices.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Xamarin development](#xamarin) below.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Xamarin development](#xamarin) below.
